entry.title: Mikhail Gorbachev, Reformer of Soviet Union, Dies at 91
entry.content: The architect of “perestroika” and “glasnost”—restructuring and openness—unleashed a wave of unstoppable forces that led to the bloc’s demise in 1991.

entry.title: Deadly Baghdad Violence Condemned by Iraqi Cleric Sadr
entry.content: The prominent Shia Muslim cleric, whose withdrawal from public life triggered deadly clashes, condemned his supporters for attacking security forces and called on them to leave the city’s Green Zone.

entry.title: How Two Mexican Drug Cartels Came to Dominate America's Fentanyl Supply
entry.content: The Sinaloa and Jalisco organizations have taken over from Chinese sellers as a dominant source of the potent synthetic opioid, a leading cause of the U.S.’s record overdoses. Among the reasons, it is easier and less expensive to produce than heroin.
